stories.text:
Hello everyone, 
I did my master's in IT and have a few years of experience as a database/system admin. My undergrad was in CS, but tbh I am not very good at programming. During my MS, I took a few DS classes (statistical learning, regression analysis, ML, data mining and knowledge discovery, big data management) and felt passionate about DS and ML. I have also taken the deep learning specialization on Coursera. I have also done some "basic" projects (most of the class projects).  However, I still don't feel comfortable in ML, especially the programming part. Also, I have not built anything that I could showcase my skills. 
What would you recommend I should do now? Do you think I should take some programming/data, science classes?
stories.title: Ask HN: how to excel in ML (not good in CS/programming and beginner in DS)
Performance-enhancing psychedelics: Can LSD make you better at sport?
InfinyOn joins the Bytecode Alliance to bring WebAssembly to data streaming
Researchers enable AI to use its “imagination”

stories.text:
Brex seems to have better cash back, while Ramp's expense management platform is more robust. Curious to hear everyones's thoughts on this matter specifically for a Seed - Series A startup.

I'm thinking it could be more optimal to use Brex for now and switch to Ramp down the line when we have a bigger team and a dedicated finance person.
stories.title: Ask HN: Ramp vs. Brex for Seed – Series A Startup
